content.p: Pusat KOMAS Internship Description: Pusat KOMAS is a human rights popular communications (PC) centre set up in August 1993 to empower especially the indigenous peoples, urban poor, workers and civil society organisations to advocate for human rights in Malaysia. This approach was popularised in Latin America during the 1970â€™s amongst the peasant communities struggling for liberation from repressive regimes governing their countries. Since then community educators and organisers have adopted it in different parts of the world, adapting to their respective context and have replicated these approaches to address their respective issues. The basic principles of PC are, people centeredness, process oriented, creative in nature and adheres to a community organising and rights-based approach. How to apply: Students is encouraged to write to Pusat KOMAS with the subject line 'Internship' at info@komas.org with their CV or address them to: Pusat KOMAS A-2-10 8 Avenue Jalan Sungai Jernih 8/1 Seksyen 8 46050 Petaling Jaya Selangor Tel: +603-7968 5415 telephone: +6 (03) 8924 8000 fax: +6 (03) 8924 8001
